item.title: Schools in Kilby
item.description: Kilby is aboutÂ 8 miles south-east of Leicester, and on the Grand Union Canal. Like many south-Leicestershire villages, in the early 19th century, many of the inhabitants were framework knitters. The village is closely linked with that of Wistow through common land ownership.
item.dc:creator: PamF

item.title: Kilby Probate Material
item.description:
Some 7 miles south of Leicester, Kilby is a rural village of approximately 100 households and is unusual in having four farmyards opening directly on to the main street. The church, which post-dates the gravestones in the churchyard, stands down a small lane away from the main part of the village.

Inventory of Elizabeth Brown the elder, 1675
item.dc:creator: PamF
